title: How to Plant and Manage Summer Trap Crops

tasks.task: Planting and managing trap crops for pest management on a small farm.
subtasks: Planting NK300 sorghum as a trap crop 2 weeks before the main crop.
Planting prodovic sunflower as a trap crop 2 weeks before the main crop.
Stagger planting rows of trap crops for small farms.
Timing planting of sorghum and sunflower in April and May.
Using a garden push type planter for planting trap crop seeds.
Maintaining appropriate plant density for sorghum (two plants per foot).
Applying nitrogen side dressing to promote rapid sorghum growth.
Irrigating sunflowers using drip tape for better germination.
Planting sunflowers to the outside to capture early season pests.
Maintaining spacing for farm machinery (tills and sprayers) between rows.
Scouting insects on trap crops (at least 20 seed heads) regularly.
Monitoring insect counts on main crops to decide when to treat.
Removing target pests from trap crops to prevent migration.
Applying insecticide treatments (e.g., Warrior and Mustang Max) in conventional systems.
Implementing organic pest management if needed.
Destroying trap crops at season's end to prevent pest carryover.
